More than 300 marketers share what to automate now and what may be next

[vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1562679189401{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}”]If you think of marketing automation and picture a set-it-and-forget-it approach devoid of human connection, we’ve got news for you. Automation doesn’t mean automatically impersonal.

Instead, effective marketers use automation to put a personalized touch on their outreach and help customers get to know their brands.

Find out how your use of marketing automation compares with your competitors in this free eBook by SharpSpring and Social Media Today.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”We’ll break down:” font_container=”tag:h5|text_align:left” google_fonts=”font_family:Open%20Sans%3A300%2C300italic%2Cregular%2Citalic%2C600%2C600italic%2C700%2C700italic%2C800%2C800italic|font_style:300%20light%20regular%3A300%3Anormal” css=”.vc_custom_1573475491023{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” el_class=”xm-hide font-size-30px”][vc_column_text el_class=”list-unstyled list-chevron xm-hide”]

  • How today’s marketers are using marketing automation
  • The biggest concerns about relying on automated processes
  • Where marketers are headed next
